text: Heikki Hedman (born 25 April 1940) is a former tennis player from Finland. ==Tennis career== Hedman represented Finland in the Davis Cup competition during the period 1958 to 1969. He made his debut for the Finland team during the 1958 Europe Zone second round tie against Mexico, losing both his singles matches. His next appearance was six years later in the 1964 Europe Zone first round tie against Denmark. Hedman played six Davis Cup singles and three doubles rubbers, with only one victory in a doubles match. In 1969 Hedman founded TennisHedman, a tennis school in Helsinki. ==See also== *List of Finland Davis Cup team representatives ==References== ==External links== * * Category:1940 births Category:Living people Category:Finnish male tennis players
title: Heikki Hedman
